key_title: Key to the species of Luzula

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Juncaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Luzula
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Luzula. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Inflorescence umbellate, with 3 or more stalked clusters (sometimes the stalks very short in putative hybrids involving L. novae-cambriae)
Inflorescence of a single cluster or of several close-spaced, sessile clusters, or with one or two stalked clusters

Leaves thin-textured, flat, usually with 3–5 longitudinal veins clearly visible on upper surface; fibrous leaf remnants lacking or persisting for about one year only; plants commonly bulbous; tepals and capsules pale to dark brown (mostly pale in alps); caruncle about one-third as long as seed; mostly lowland to montane sites

Leaves rather thick, channelled, with obscure venation; fibrous leaf remnants of several seasons usually persisting at base; plants not bulbous; tepals and capsules usually dark brown or blackish; caruncle about one-eighth as long as seed; alpine or subalpine, typically of exposed, rocky sites
Leaves channelled, 1–2 mm wide; tepals and capsules dark brown or blackish; tepals with narrow margins
Leaves flattish, 3 mm wide or more; tepals and capsules pale to mid-brown (rarely deep reddish-brown), tepals with rather broad pale margins

Anthers 0.8–1.3 mm long; inflorescence often consisting of 2–4 sessile or subsessile clusters on stem up to c. twice as high as leaves; at least the young leaves acute-tipped, distinctly ciliate at base; fibrous leaf remnants of leaves often persisting as a thick basal stocking

Anthers about 0.5 mm long; inflorescence a single globose cluster on stem much more than twice as high as leaves; leaves glabrous or only sparsely ciliate near base; fibrous leaf remnants not persisting at base of plant
Leaves flat or slightly channelled, 2–7 mm wide
Anthers about 1 mm long; tepals with narrow margins
Anthers about 0.5 mm long; tepals with rather broad, pale margins
Inflorescence typically spherical to ovoid; leaves flaccid; caruncle of seed about one-third seed length; body of seed about 0.8 mm
Inflorescence typically oblong or conical in outline; leaves thickish; caruncle of seed minute, about one-eighth seed length; body of seed about 1.3 mm long
